meanings.definition: To obtain something by devious or dishonest means.
meanings.sent1: He fleeched his way into getting extra cookies by pretending to be hungry.
meanings.sent2: The thief fleeched the jewels from the museum under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The sly fox fleeched the chickens out of their coop with promises of a grand feast.
meanings.sent4: She fleeched her way into the exclusive club by sweet-talking the bouncer.
meanings.sent5: The con artist fleeched money from unsuspecting victims with his smooth words.

meanings.sent1: She fleeched her little brother into sharing his toys by offering him a candy.
meanings.sent2: The salesman fleeched the customer into buying the expensive vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to fleech the dog into giving up the ball by offering a treat.
meanings.sent4: He fleeched his way into getting a discount on the car by charming the salesperson.
meanings.sent5: The teacher fleeched the students into participating in the class activity with promises of a fun time.

meanings.definition: To flatter or cajole in order to persuade.
meanings.sent1: She fleeched her boss by complimenting his tie to get a day off.
meanings.sent2: The politician fleeched the voters with promises of lower taxes.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to fleech his parents into letting him stay up late by saying they were the best parents ever.
meanings.sent4: He fleeched his way into getting the promotion by praising his colleague's work.
meanings.sent5: The student fleeched the teacher by praising her lectures to get an extension on the assignment.
